page.title: 17Burton Latimer - Buildings
page.content: STATION ROAD. It runs westwards from the A6 trunk road.It passes the Weetabix & Alumasc factories & runs over the River Ise & London to Edinburgh railway.The old station house is on the west side of the railway line.Station Rd.has many different houses.The oldest being built at the end of the 19th century to accom odate the workers in the local shoe factories,& the rest being built from 1930 onwards.Most of the houses are red brick,many pebble dashed or limewashed. The roofs are tiled or slated.
